notesStmt.note: An Italian note, signed by Bart[olomeo] Rocca di Praterino, giving permission to Avraham Segre to use the book according to his will: folio 291v.A legal document in Italian, on the quarto paper leaf attached on guard at the end of the voume, dated 16 Marheshvan 5503 (13 November 1742). Samson Segre agrees to print the manuscript together with Jacob London and Isaac Berakhyah Kanton, in Amsterdam, London, or elsewhere.Inner side of folio 1r (front flyleaf): descriptions on modern paper of two works by Natanael Diodato Segre (῾Atarat tiferet Savoya and Nezer ha-ḳodesh mi-Savoya). The Duke Charles Emmanuel is therein extolled. Dated 1622.
Manuscript description based on Margoliouth, G.: Catalogue of the Hebrew and Samaritan Manuscripts in the British Museum, London 1965.
